data.title: Apple News Podcast
data.meta_description: Stay ahead with MacBreak Weekly podcast for expert analysis on everything Apple. Join Leo Laporte, Alex Lindsay, Andy Ihnatko, and Jason Snell for the latest Apple news.
data.text:
More about MacBreak Weekly:

The MacBreak Weekly tech podcast covers everything related to Apple Inc. from the place you get your Apple news podcasts or wherever you get your PC or Mac Podcasts. From the latest product announcements to what's coming down the pipeline, MacBreak Weekly has it all covered. Tech experts Leo Laporte, Andy Ihnatko, Alex Lindsay, and Jason Snell thoroughly examine the Mac, iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch, and Apple TV and keep sharp eyes on any news, including Apple event announcements and internal workings. The hosts deliver thoughtful commentary on changes in Apple's services like Apple Music and Fitness+, company earnings, manufacturing practices, the effect of local, national, and global tech policies, privacy concerns, regulations and governmental oversight, legal issues, and competitive edge. With extensive experience covering Apple and the tech industry, the MBW hosts go well beyond the specs. They cut through the company hype and present it all in an approachable, conversational style. Subscribe to MacBreak Weekly to get a weekly dose of in-depth Apple-focused technology news. The show records live on Tuesdays at 2 pm ET / 11 am PT and is published to all major podcast apps (where you find your Mac podcasts, including where you find your Apple news podcasts) within 12 hours.

Apple Topics Covered on This Podcast

MacBreak Weekly covers technological innovations, new products and services, and the constant reshaping of the tech industry from an Apple-focused perspective. Our hosts talk frankly and often critically about the latest Apple devices, chips, operating systems, Apple's services, privacy issues, global reach, and more. They discuss what the company's products and services mean to the tech industry as a whole, what the future may look like, and consider historical perspectives. We try to go above and beyond what other Apple news podcasts or Mac podcasts do, in an effort to keep you informed. Take a listen and find out why you will love to listen to us as one of your favorite PC or Mac podcasts in the near future.

From Breaking News to In-Depth Analysis from Your New Favorite Apple New Podcast

In 2020, Apple made a splash with its new Apple Silicon M1 chip, and MacBreak Weekly immediately put the news in perspective. Leo, Rene, Andy, and Alex dissect the latest Apple gadgets as soon as they hit the market. That includes the iPhone, the iPad, AirPods, Apple Watch, Mac, MacBook, and iMac computers, displays, and Apple services like the App Store, Apple Arcade, Apple TV+, and Apple Music. This Apple news podcast offers timely commentary on Apple announcements, including from their annual events such as WWDC and iPhone launches. If you are a fan of Apple then it is one of the Mac podcasts you cannot miss.

You'll also get reviews of Apple products, apps, and accessories the hosts recommend or not. They put all the news and information in context with their vast knowledge of Apple's past work, present focus, and future plans. They also delve into Apple's position in the technology landscape, its impacts on privacy, current events, economics, politics, our personal lives, and more. We aim to be the best in the crowded field of Apple news podcasts. We think we can prove that we are one of the very best, if not the best, from the very first listen of our podcast. Consider adding us to your list of current Mac podcasts or Windows-based podcasts you listen to on a regular basis.

MacBreak Weekly's Beginnings and Format

MacBreak Weekly premiered on August 12th, 2006, as an audio spinoff of MacBreak, a PixelCorps production, and the podcast has evolved over the years. In its current format, hosts examine a wide range of technology news about or related to Apple and conclude the show with Picks of the Week. The picks include apps, gadgets, services, shows, and more recommendations. It will turn into one of your favorite Mac podcasts if not one of your favorite Apple news podcasts.

Other Tech Podcasts and Apple News Podcasts You're Sure to Love

If you're an Apple enthusiast with a discerning mind who wants to be deeply informed while being entertained, MacBreak Weekly is the perfect podcast out there amongst the sea of Apple news podcasts for you. Here are some other TWiT Mac podcasts, Apple podcasts, or technology news podcasts you're sure also to enjoy:

iOS Today

If you use an iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch, or any other Apple device, you've got to listen to iOS Today. Hosts Mikah Sargent and Rosemary Orchard share their vast iOS knowledge every week so that you can get the most out of your iOS device. From app reviews to helpful tips and tricks, from the latest news to the coolest accessories, Rosemary and Mikah know how to use iOS to the fullest and are here to help you too. Rosemary is an automation and productivity expert, and Mikah is an iOS expert and is into wellness and conscientiousness. Together, they bring a show that's full of information and geeky fun. It will turn into one of the Apple news podcasts you cannot miss. Find us on the app store of your choice and give us the chance to become one of your favorite new iOS or Mac podcasts.

Hands-On Mac

Hands-On Mac explores and explains the Mac — and beyond! From clever Terminal commands to little-known iOS settings, Mikah Sargent shares all the best tips and tricks for your Mac, iPad, iPhone, and Apple Watch. You'll get all the details on Apple's apps and the best apps in the App Store, you'll learn about awesome accessories for your Apple devices, and you'll explore updates to Apple's operating systems — including iOS, macOS, iPadOS, and watchOS. Hands-On Mac is your one-stop shop for Apple know-how.

Tech News Weekly

Industry expert Mikah Sargent, brings you interviews from tech journalists who make or break the top stories of the week. Get the freshest perspective and in depth insight into the fast-paced world of technology from Tech News Weekly.

This Week in Google

It's not just Google. This Week in Google hosts, Leo Laporte, Jeff Jarvis, and Paris Martineau, cover all of Big Tech every Wednesday. Listeners tune in for thought-provoking and entertaining conversations about AI, Internet memes, the future of media, and the latest emerging tech. You won't want to miss a minute.

This Week in Tech

This Week in Tech is the top-ranked flagship tech podcast from TWiT.tv. Every Sunday, Leo Laporte and a roundtable of insiders explore the week's hottest tech news from AI to robots, and PCs to privacy. When it comes to tech, TWiT is IT.

Security Now

Cybersecurity guru Steve Gibson joins Leo Laporte every Tuesday. Steve and Leo break down the latest cybercrime and hacking stories, offering a deep understanding of what's happening and how to protect yourself and your business. Security Now is a must listen for security professionals every week.

Be sure to check out other TWiT.tv podcasts and discover all the in-depth tech news you crave. We have the information you will love if you love Apple news podcasts or other tech news hitting your Mac podcasts or PC podcasts.

Reasons to Listen to us beyond our Apple news podcasts:
